moves.1. Nc3 Nc6 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Ne5 Ne4 4. Nxc6: The white square bishops are the first casualties from the initial position.
moves.10. d4 d5 11. exd5 exd5 12. b3 e6 13. Re: Now, with no bishops left, the rooks are vital...
I have a three pawn advantage here...
moves.33. Kc2 Ke5 34. a4 Rf4 35. Rc3 d4 36. Rd: I go for a pawn promotion here.
moves.40... Rf2+ 41. Ke1 Ra2 42. b4 Rxa6: Instead of removing my rook with his king, my opponent stops my pawn on the sixth rank
moves.43. b5 Rb6 44. Rb3: My pawn now has some cover
moves.52. Qh2+: ...and my queen comes to the rescue...
moves.52... Kd1 53. Rxd3+ Rd2 54. Qxd2#: ...to allow me to claim a very lucky victory.

gameName: No queens or knights... how will you do? II
